snippet: Islan Nettles, 21, who was killed last month in Harlem, had recently transformed from a shy, insecure youth into a radiant young woman who was designing her own fashion line.
abstract: Brutal death of transgender black woman Islan Nettles, killed in Harlem in September 2013, has incensed New York’s transgender community, many whom have experienced violence themselves and have spent years overcoming past abuse, depression and thoughts of suicide; police have arrested Paris Wilson, but have only charged him with misdemeanor assault.
lead_paragraph: Islan Nettles, 21, who was killed last month in Harlem, had recently transformed from a shy, insecure youth into a radiant young woman who was designing her own fashion line.

headline.main: Embarking on a New Life, Transgender Woman Has It Brutally Taken
headline.print_headline: Embarking on a New Life, Transgender Woman Has It Brutally Taken
